intro: Sagittaria spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves that emerge from a rhizomatous root system, allowing it to spread across shallow water or moist soils. The plant produces small, white flowers in clusters at the water’s surface, which are pollinated by insects and wind. Its rhizomes help stabilize soil and improve water quality by filtering sediments. Sagittaria spathulata is an important component of aquatic ecosystems, providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
